localStorage.persistance: No expiration date. Persists indefinitely until deleted. Remains available after browser is closed and reopened.
localStorage.scope: Partitioned by origin (protocol, host, port). All documents from the same origin have access.
localStorage.use_case: Storing data that needs to persist across multiple browsing sessions (User preferences, Offline Data).

sessionStorage.persistance: Cleared as soon as the browser tab/window is closed. Does NOT persist across browser sessions.
sessionStorage.scope: Partitioned by origin and browser tabs/windows. Each tab/window has a separate session storage.
sessionStorage.use_case: Storing temporary data relevant to the current browsing session (Data for a multi-step process).

Description.overview: Asynchronous JavaScript And XML (commonly used with JSON instead of XML). Used in client-side JavaScript to send HTTP reqs to a server and receive responses without needing to reload the web page. AJAX calls allow web pages to communicate asynchronously with servers in the background.
`XMLHttpRequest` object is a built-in browser API used for AJAX requests.
Description.use_case: Sending HTTP requests (GET, POST, etc) from browsers JavaScript to a server endpoint. Receiving data (JSON or text) from server to update web page dynamically.

steps.create_object:
new XMLHttpRequest object
`const xhttp = new XMLHttpRequest();`
steps.define_callback: assign a function to the `onreadystatechange` property. `xhttp.onreadystatechange = function() {}`
steps.open_configure: Specify HTTP method, server URL, and if request is asynchronous. `xhttp.open("GET", "http://example.com/api/data?id=123", true);`

Description.elements: Full overview of HTML and CSS. Modify CSS styles live. Inspect and edit DOM nodes.
Description.console: JavaScript output (Errors, Logs, Warnings). Can be used to execute browser JavaScript.
Description.sources: All files loaded by the page. Set breakpoints and debug JavaScript.
Description.network: Speed Testing. Inspect HTTP requests and responses. Check headers, payloads, and response times.
Description.performance: Record runtime performance profiles. Identify rendering or scripting bottlenecks.
Description.memory: Detect memory leaks and monitor heap usage. Take heap snapshots.
Description.application: Manage Local Storage, cookies, sessionStorage, and IndexedDB. Inspect service workers.
Description.security: View SSL/TLS certificate details. Detect mixed content or security policy issues.

Description.origin: Defined by: Protocol, Domain, Port. Example: 'https://example.com:443' !== 'http://example.com:80'
Description.isolation: Data stored in one origin cannot be accessed by another origin. Prevents cross-site data leakage.
Description.localStorage: Persistent Storage: indefinite storage. Persists after browser is closed. Shared across all tabs and windows of the same origin.
Description.sessionStorage: Temporary storage: data cleared when the tab or window is closed. Unique to each browser tab, even on the same origin.
Description.security_note: Web storage is accessible through JavaScript. Vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. Passwords or tokens should not be stored in `localStorage` or `sessionStorage`.

Description.overview: Local storage and Session Storage both use these methods.
Description.setItem: Stores data under a specified key. `localStorage.setItem("user", JSON.stringify(user));`
Description.getItem: Retrieves the value associated with a specific key. Returns value as a string, or `null` if !key.
Description.removeItem: Removes a single key-value pair from storage.
Description.clear: Removes all key-value pairs from the entire storage object for the current domain.
Description.key: Retrieve the name of a key based on a zero-based index.

Description.overview: Converts a JavaScript object or value into a JSON String. Useful for storing objects in localStorage or sending data to a server.
Converts a JSON string back into a JavaScript object.

Description.innerHTML: Gets or sets HTML markup in an element. Use when inserting or replacing HTML content. `document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "Hello World!"`
Description.textContent: Gets or sets the text content of an element; ignores any HTML tags. Use for inserting plain text. `document.getElementById("demo").textContent = "Hello World!";` // Would literally display 'Hello World!'
Description.innerText: Similar to `textContent` but respects CSS styling and hidden elements (e.g., ignores text inside `display: none`).

Description.overview: Functions that execute in response to specific events (clicks, key presses, page loads).
Description.ways_to_add:
Inline HTML: `<button onclick="alert('Clicked!')">`
JavaScript Property: `document.getElementById("btn").onclick = function() {}`
addEventListener (preferred): `document.getElementById("btn").addEventListener("click", () => {})`
Description.advantages_of_addEventListener: Can attach multiple handlers to the same event. Supports event removal with `removeEventListener()`. Keeps HTML and JavaScript separate.

Description.overview: Function assigned to `onreadystatechange` is crucial for handling server response. Called whenever `readyState` property of the XHR object changes.

key_features.readyState: Indicates the current state of the request (0: UNSENT, 1: OPENED, 2: HEADER_RECEIVED, 3: LOADING, 4: DONE).
key_features.status: Standard HTTP status code (e.g., 200, 404). Only relevant when `readyState` is 4.

Description.strings: All values stored in `localStorage` and `sessionStorage` are strings by default. Numbers and booleans are also converted to strings.
Description.objects: Objects and arrays must be converted prior to storage. Use `JSON.stringify()` to store and `JSON.parse()` to retrieve.
Description.supported_data: Primitive Types (Strings, Numbers, Booleans), Complex Types via JSON (arrays, objects).

Description.overview: Double quotes for keys and string values. No trailing commas. Allowed data types: string, number, object, array, boolean, null.
